abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Montenegro
            Earthquake Rehabilitation (Highways) Project in Yugoslavia
            was achieved and as a result allowed exposure to a less
            developed region which resulted in increasing employment and
            economic development. The project suffered a nine month slow
            down due to lack of funds.  The slowdown resulted in a slow
            disbursement of loan money. The Bank was flexible in
            agreeing to emergency repair and rehabilitation works being
            completed on the basis of contracts with unit rates,
            determined in advance and agreed to by all contractors,
            proved to be expedient. The borrower requested that the
            Investment Bank of Titograd act as fiscal agent for this
            single Republic loan, instead of the Council of Republican
            and Provincial Road Organizations. The Bank agreed and the
            arrangement was satisfactory and sped up document
            transmission which resulted in quicker loan disbursements.

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project provides assistance
            to the Socialist Republic of Montenegro in restoring about
            560 km of main and regional roads damaged in the earthquakes
            of April 15 and May 24, 1979. Benefits comprise the
            restoration of the movement of goods and people over the
            projects roads to an effective level. All affected roads
            carried considerable volumes of traffic; their closure or
            restriction to limited usage would affect adversely all
            sectors of the economy.
